title: Enhancing Business Strategy Competencies: Learning Strategies of Multinational Corporations in Emerging Markets and International Business Theories

context.prior_knowledge: Basic international business theories and understanding of global market structures
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can analyze growth factors of Emerging Market Multinational Enterprises (EMNEs) using three or more variables (e.g., political systems, industrial structures) and generate mathematical comparison models.
Through case-based PBL, learners can evaluate knowledge-intensive industry development strategies (e.g., M&A) of EMNEs using quantitative metrics.
Learners can mathematically diagram a dynamic framework of international business theories reflecting changing global environments (technology, institutions).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
